intro: Schwannia lindmanii, commonly known as the Lindman's schwannia, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish composite flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Schwannia lindmanii is considered a species of conservation concern.
